intro: Elutheria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved elutheria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals, and it produces small, red berries. Elutheria microphylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
